cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CY

This paper is about text classification, which falls under the subfield of natural language processing (NLP) in computer science. The paper proposes a minimalistic and wide system for text classification, which involves text transformations, text representations, and a supervised learning algorithm. This system can be applied to various text classification tasks, including topic and polarity classification, spam detection, user profiling, and authorship attribution. Therefore, the most likely sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and computational linguistics. 

The paper also mentions the use of hyperparameter optimization, which is a common technique in machine learning to fine-tune the parameters of a model for better performance. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers the theory and applications of machine learning algorithms. 

Furthermore, the paper involves the use of supervised learning, which is a type of learning where the model is trained on labeled data. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which covers the retrieval of information from large datasets using machine learning and other techniques. 

The paper also mentions that their approach does not require knowledge of machine learning and NLP, which suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which covers the development of intelligent
